infos.title: The Illusion Gambler
infos.like: Mumbo Jumbo Runic Cube, Piano Concerto No. 7 of Hayedden, Silver Catfish Filet spiced with 4 drops of lemon juice
infos.dislike: Fishing earthworms, con artists, everything that's spicy
infos.story: Born with the spirit of a wandering artist, Esker was a star magician of the Stardust, a wandering theater troupe, until he was framed by Prime Minister El Moriham of Orvelia and disappeared. Just when everyone started forgetting about him, he came out to the world as one of the most dangerous gamblers in the secret gambling world.
infos.story_: Born with the spirit of a wandering artist, Esker was a star magician of the Stardust, a wandering theater troupe, until he was framed by Prime Minister El Moriham of Orvelia and disappeared. Just when everyone started forgetting about him, he came out to the world as one of the most dangerous gamblers in the secret gambling world. 'The Illusion Gambler.' That was what his challengers called him, trembling in fear. The gamblers that played with him all described him in a similar manner. As soon as they faced Esker's unique laughter, his soft voice, and his empty eyes, they all felt nauseated by the suspicion that the man in the front was reading their every move.

uw.name: Wanderer's Pleasure, Lu Estrona Dice
uw.description: Upon a Critical Skill Hit, increases M.DMG that target receives by (0) for 10 sec and recovers own Mana by (1).
uw.story: A pair dice once used by Hexipolia, the Wandering Illusion Clown. He was a renowned mage and artist in ancient times who traveled all across the continent to give joy to people and help them forget their troubles. His performance was a solace and hope to people living in confusing times, and they loved him to the extent that they made the Moon of Hexipolia after he passed away in honor of his noble spirit. However, the mentally demanding nature of Hexipolia's craft slowly gnawed into his soul, making him suffer from loneliness and depression. He wanted to give up on his natural gift, but the shadow cast upon people was just too deep; he knew too well what his performances meant to his audience. It was his destiny to amuse people. Lu Etrona Dice is what he made to amuse himself during his painful journey of entertainment. He condensed his Mana into the dice and gave it the power to form a dimensional illusion. When rolled, the dice opened up an imaginary world where Hexipolia could find some peace. The dice was passed down to the descendants of his life-long pursuit for clowning, but it disappeared when the ancient civilization collapsed. And now, the dice is in the hands of a man called the Illusion Gambler. Being used in a completely different way, against its maker's intentions... It is said that the dice appeared in Esker's hands with blinding lights when he desperately wanted to escape this world.

1.name: Mumbo Jumbo Runic Cube
1.description: [This is My Game] Increases DMG by (0) and the number of hits by 1.
1.story: A toy cube that Esker used to play with Ophelia when she was feeling down. The Cube lets out a gleaming light when the Runic letters are put together, and starts playing a beautiful melody when completely solved. Ophelia would often feel depressed that she didn't know what the man of her destiny she met in her dreams looked like. In such cases, Esker would, just as he did to calm his sister down, take this cube out and let her watch him solve the cube.

2.name: Indispensable Chess Piece
2.description: [My Turn] The effect of My Turn becomes irremovable and additionally grants (0) ATK Spd per stack to the ally with the highest attack.
2.story: A chess piece that belonged to Esker's performance partner in Stardust. When the magic show was over, the duo would play chess and talk about their performance earlier. The day that the 'incident' happened and Esker decided to leave the troupe, no one but his partner knew what he had in mind. Handing this chess piece in Esker's hands, he told Esker not to forget Stardust and to come back when he could.

3.name: Old Fishing Rod
3.description: [Shall I Try My Luck?] Reduces Mana Cost by 1 and increases M.DMG target receives by (0) for 10 sec.
3.story: A fishing rod for kids that Esker's childhood friend gave him as a present. There was an annoying boy living in a town that Stardust would visit during annual tours. The boy, Lucias, would read the boring bible to Esker and frighten him with stag beetles. Esker hated him for always smiling like an idiot at first, but they soon became close friends. When Stardust came to visit Lucias's town on another tour, the two exchanged a token of friendship, and this fishing rod was what Lucias gave Esker. Since then, Esker had to go fishing with Lucias every time he would come to the town.

4.name: Shady Chip
4.description: [This Is Not a Trick] Increases ATK and DEF boost by 50%. ATK Spd of self is increased by (0) per stack.
4.story: A strange gambling chip used in black market gambling houses. This is the most valuable chip of them all, and only the best adventurer in the secret gambling house could own it. It looks like a regular golden gambling chip, but it holds life forces of countless souls due to the spell of Dark Wizards cast on it.

Depending on the number of the dice's dots, immediately reduces Cooldown of Esker's next Soul Weapon use by 10% and increases ATK of all allies by 12% for 60 sec. The ATK Boost effect can be stacked up to max 5 times.

advancement.1: Changes the max number of stacks to 7 times.
advancement.2: Increases DEF Penetration of all allies by 50 per every stack.

sw.story:
A pair of dice that appeared one day with a brilliant light and sheltered itself inside Esker's grasp.
Esker cast the dice onto the gambling table.

The moment the dice parted his hand, it would create a dimension of fantasy taking whatever shape its master wanted. The dice held bewitching magic that enchanted Esker's opponent into believing what's not real is real.
Lies, created to confuse his opponents.

But this power came with a cost.

To create a world that was not supposed to exist, the pair of dice required an enormous amount of Esker's willpower. The price of opening the grand illusion was to have horrible nightmares that consumed Esker every night.
It was a night that was so horrible that Esker could barely distinguish reality from his nightmares.
Just when Esker was about to give up on everything because of the pain, he painfully reminisced Stardust.
His favorite place of all.

The dice escaped Esker's grasp and rolled away slowly as it opened a dimension never seen before. Esker heard someone's footsteps across the area he created.

'Finally. It's the first time you made my dice do what they were supposed to do.'

A smiling face could be seen faintly.

'You, who are born to be a wanderer, you may use this dice as you please. I will not intervene at any moment.'
'But know this: I will always watch you from this illusion so that you do not walk the lonely road by yourself.'

Hexipolia the Wanderer, the ancient one, the creator of the dice revealed its true form to Esker
